title: sGC Stimulator Validation: Cardiovascular Predictions Beyond HF/PAH

chronic kidney disease.evidence: Preclinical renoprotection; runcaciguat in clinical development for CKD

diabetic nephropathy.evidence: sGC stimulators show consistent renoprotective effects in preclinical models

proteinuria.evidence: Reduced in preclinical CKD models with sGC stimulators

peripheral vascular disease.evidence: NO clinical trials found; sGC/cGMP pathway relevant to vascular function

peripheral arterial diseases.evidence: Same as PVD - mechanism plausible, no trials

stroke.evidence: NO clinical trials for riociguat; CY6463 in Phase II for MELAS (stroke-like)

ischemic cerebrovascular disorder.evidence: Same as stroke - mechanism plausible for neuroprotection

coronary artery disease.evidence: sGC pathway relevant; no dedicated CAD trials for riociguat

duchenne muscular dystrophy.evidence: NO clinical trials found; not in development for DMD

kidney failure.evidence: Riociguat NOT recommended for CrCl <15-30; too advanced

autosomal dominant polycystic kidney dis.evidence: NO trials for sGC stimulators in ADPKD

key_findings: sGC stimulators show 22.7% strict precision (validated) or 45.5% lenient (+ plausible)
Renal protection is validated in preclinical models (CKD, diabetic nephropathy, proteinuria)
Peripheral vascular predictions are mechanistically plausible but lack clinical trials
Toxemia of pregnancy is CONTRAINDICATED - pregnancy is a contraindication for riociguat
Many predictions (55%) have no clinical evidence or mechanism
